issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Should fix in 4.0, please...this just looks unprofessional if we leave it like this, even though everything is operational. 

Including IAM user page screenshot. It looks like on initial load of a landing page with a table (seen for sure on mac osx 10.9.2 chrome Version 34.0.1847.131) the spacing between the row contents is vertically taller than the colored row backgrounds. 

If you change tabs and come back, the contents shrink up to be sized correctly, but if you then reload using the browser's reload button or the app's reload button, the spacing will get wonky again. Only happens on IAM users page, only in chrome. Using mac osx 10.9.2, chrome Version 34.0.1847.131
fields.summary: IAM user landing page table rows not lining up with the backgrounds

comments.body: This appears to be an issue only on the IAM Users landing page and only on Chrome (tested with Chrome 34.0.1847.131 on Mac OS 10.8.5).  [~jloza]: Could you confirm?
yep, verified not seeing in FF or on any other landing pages than the IAM users page. Updated ticket title and description to reflect that. Thanks!
Voting to punt this since it only affects the IAM users landing page (only on Chrome) and it isn't a trivial fix.

[~kgill] can you detail what's involved in the fix? It's just so terrible looking, and for the newest feature that everyone will be trying and we want to highlight to customers, it's really awful to have something look this bad...
I see this in chrome, but not FF. It looks like as the table gets updated from the JSON calls, the table rows are not resizing. I see the resizing behavior fine in FF, but Chrome fails to do this.
Checking out on OS X 10.6.8 Chrome  32.0.1700.77, I cannot reproduce this issue at the moment, even after creating the identical set of users shown in the attachment.
[~dkavanagh]: We should file a bug with the Chromium project, since all other browsers appear to handle this just fine.
Can we also fix this for ourselves? Users don't know the problem is with the browser, they only know our software looks wonky.
My plan is to have a transparent state icon that sets the row height to the final size from the start (before lazy loaded data comes in).
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/775
Pull request 775 merged, assigning to [~jloza] for spot check before sending to QA.
looks good! Thanks, [~dkavanagh]

I was able to reproduce this on Chrome.  The problem appears to be with zooming.  The users looked fine when the zoom is at 100%.  However, if I zoom in or out, the user list gets screwed up.  I have attached screen shots to show the behavior.  The problem does not occur on FF regardless of the zoom.
I'm going to say the zoom part is a Chrome bug that they need to fix.
I agree with [~dkavanagh], not much we can do to address the zoom behavior.

[~kgill], [~dkavanagh]: That previous test I did was in a linux environment.  I retested this again in a MAC environment and it behaves a little different.  When it first loads, the users list does not line up as described in the bug, however, if I zoom in or out, the list looks normal until I reload the page again.  I can reproduce this consistently.
let me ask about this "does not line up as described in the bug". Does that mean it doesn't show the problem described in the bug, or doesn't line up nicely?
[~dkavanagh]: With the MAC, it doesn't line up nicely as described in the original bug.

[~ccassler] I am using mac osx 10.9.2, chrome Version 35.0.1916.153 and this lines up fine even when zoomed in using the dev cloud. I've attached a screen shot showing this super zoomed (I zoomed and then reloaded the page to see if it worked both while zooming and after zooming). IMHO, this fix is OK for 4.0.1, this is the best we can do to work around the actual bug in Chrome. 

[~alice], can you take a look at this today since [~ccassler] is out and see if you can reproduce it still, and work with [~dkavanagh] to get this moved through jira, please? Thanks!

[~jloza] [~ccassler]: The last packages available for QA are from June 6. I see from the pull request that the fix was merged on June 13. We will be able to verify this when packages start building again. We are currently blocked on all verifications by GUI-1081. 

[~jloza] [~ccassler]In the packages "before fix", this bug is very evident when font size is set to "large" in the browser. Changing font size is not equivalent to zoom. We should test behavior also with font size changed, not only zoom.

Thanks for the info, [~alice]!

I just changed my font size in my chrome and checked this out in the develop branch. It looks good! Phew! 

[~alice], I think [~dkavanagh] should go ahead and put this back in QA for now and [~ccassler] can retest once the packages are fixed and his QA machine is updated. What do you think?
pls retest once GUI-1081 is resolve (i.e. we have new packages)

Thanks, [~dkavanagh] Yay!!!

[~jloza] I agree, this is most likely fixed. Let's put it back in QA.
woo hoo!

This is fixed on build:
